channel.title: Facebook/Gmail Help
channel.description:
Alright, so my default browser is Firefox, and I use that for everything else. But for some reason, Facebook and Gmail don't work the best in it. I have to use Chrome for Gmail and Facebook because in Firefox, they're both extremely slow when clicking links. They load fine, but wont work very smoothly when I click links on the pages(inbox for Gmail, or sent or whatever and requests or something else on Facebook).
I have narrowed it down to whatever the system is that Google and Facebook use. I'm not entirely sure what it is.. It's the 'thing' where when you click a link, the entire page itself doesn't reload, just the content you want.
Forgive my lack of knowledge on the subject and what words to use... I just need halp d:
Edit: Imagine going to Gmail, clicking Sent mail and it doing nothing at all. Same with every other link.

item.title: Facebook/Gmail Help
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

It seems to be a problem with my pc, it works at my girlfriends house on Firefox, and it works at my mates on Opera.

Is there a setting I could have possibly tampered with and screwed up?(I never go into about:config, rule that out)

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook/Gmail Help
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:8, topic:308590”]I have the latest version of Firefox, and all other forms of Javascript seem to work fine(not slow and laggy).[/quote]If i was a chrome fanboy i’d say it’s firefox’s fault, but obviously it’s those websites that suck anus.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook/Gmail Help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled:

It’s called AJAX btw

Which is just javascript requesting info and updating your page without you refreshing your entire page.

Javascript engine speed would be the thing that would speed up or slow down applications like facebook and gmail, and many say chrome has the fastest javascript engine there is, but I use gmail just fine in firefox 3.5 and don’t notice any latency. Have you tried the latest version of firefox?

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook/Gmail Help
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

It’s called AJAX btw

Read full topic
